Public Functions

getProgramProperty 
 char *getProgramProperty(const char *name)
Retrieve a program property value.

Parameters:
name - the property name.
Returns:
value the input property as a character string.
getProgramResource 
 void *getProgramResource(const char *name)
Retrieve a program resource. A resource is a pointer to any memory location. Resources are not saved to disk.
getProperties 
 Hashtable getProperties(FILE *fp)
Read properties from a file. The properties are read and returned as a Hashtable object.

Parameters:
fp - a FILE pointer to an open file.
Returns:
A Hashtable object containing the properties in the file.
getProperty 
 char *getProperty(Hashtable properties,
                   const char *name)
Retrieve a property value from a Hashtable.

Parameters:
name - the property name.
Returns:
value the input property as a character string.
programProperties 
 Hashtable programProperties()
Get the program hashtable.
putFileProperties 
 bool putFileProperties(Hashtable h,
                        const char *filename)
Write a Hashtable to a file. The Hashtable properties are written to the input file.

Returns:
True for success, False for error.
putProgramProperty 
 void putProgramProperty(const char *name,
                         const char *value)
Store a program property.

Parameters:
name - the property name.
value - the input property as a character string.
putProgramResource 
 void putProgramResource(const char *name,
                         void *resource)
Store a program resource. A resource is a pointer to any memory location. Resources are not saved to disk.
putProperties 
 bool putProperties(Hashtable h,
                    FILE *fp)
Write a Hashtable to a file. The Hashtable properties are written to the input FILE pointer.

Returns:
True for success, False for error.
putProperty 
 void putProperty(Hashtable properties,
                  const char *name,
                  const char *value)
Store a hashtable value.

Parameters:
properties - the Hashtable object.
name - the property name.
value - the input property as a character string.
readProgramProperties 
 void readProgramProperties(int argc,
                            const char **argv,
                            const char *default_file)
Read the program properties. The program hashtable will be emptied and read again. The properties file can be specified on the command line with the parameter "properties=file". If this parameter is not found in the command line arguments argv, the default_file will be read.

Parameters:
argc - Input number of character strings in argv.
argv - argc character strings.
default_file - The input default program properties file.
writeProgramProperties 
 bool writeProgramProperties()
Write the program properties. The program properties are written to the program property file.

Returns:
True for success, False for error.
writeProperties 
 bool writeProperties(Hashtable h)
Write properties to a file. The properties in the Hashtable are written to a file as paramters strings of the form parameter=value.

Parameters:
h - A Hashtable.
Returns:
True for success, False for error.
